summary: Ecosystem encompasses both biological communities and modern, decentralized structures. Originally denoting organisms and their environments, the term now extends across disciplines and geographies, fostering new, non-hierarchical frameworks. It promotes the concept of Ecosystem Architecture, which encourages decentralized and thriving organizations beyond traditional boundaries.
excerpt: Ecosystem describes a biological community bound by space and time. Its metaphorical use signifies a shift towards decentralized structures. Ecosystem Architecture emerges as a new practice to cultivate thriving, dispersed organizations.
